reference_summary:
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ken Olin', 'Lawrence Trilling', 'Jack Bender', 'Daniel Attias', 'J.J. Abrams', 'Tucker Gates', 'Frederick E.O. Toye', 'Craig Zisk', 'Perry Lang', 'Jeffrey Bell'], 'Starring': ['Jennifer Garner', 'Ron Rifkin', 'Michael Vartan'], 'Studio': ['ABC']} This is a fascinating program. I'm glad Amazon offers it so I can watch more than one episode at a time. The CIA or not. The truth or not. Good person or bad. That's what we get to ponder. Well acted with likable but devious characters Cliffhanger {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jack Bender', 'Peter Leto', 'David Barrett', 'Sergio Mimica-Gezzan', 'Kari Skogland', 'Eriq La Salle', 'Edward Ornelas', 'Peter Weller', 'Roxann Dawson', 'Paul A. Edwards'], 'Starring': ['Mike Vogel', 'Rachelle Lefevre', 'Natalie Martinez'], 'Studio': ['CBS']} This is a fascinating program with different personalities coping with an unusual and difficult situation I am so happy Amazon put this program on Roku so I can watch more than one episode at a time ... most of the endings are "cliff hangers" and waiting a week to see what happens would be too long Love, anger and secrets {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ben Stiller'], 'Producers': ['Scott Rudin', 'Ben Stiller', 'Stuart Cornfeld'], 'Starring': ['Ben Stiller', 'Owen Wilson', 'Christine Taylor'], 'Studio': ['Paramount Pictures']} I didn't see the whole film - just too sophomoric to waste hours on. Twelve year old boys would probably like it Too silly {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ed Bianchi', 'Nicole Kassell', 'Phil Abraham', 'Daniel Attias', 'Keith Gordon', 'Agnieszka Holland', 'Lodge Kerrigan', 'Brad Anderson', 'Patty Jenkins', 'Jonathan Demme'], 'Starring': ['Mireille Enos', 'Joel Kinnaman']} I have just started watching this series. Seattle homicide detective Sarah Linden, is asked to investigate the case of Rosie Larsen, a teenage girl who disappeared after attending a school dance on what was supposed to be Sarah's last day in Seattle. Sarah's fiance is expecting her and her daughter to come to their new home and continue wedding plans. So far, Sarah hasn't been able to get away.

The story continues as a car is pulled from a local lake and Rosie's body is in the trunk. Oh oh, the vehicle is registered to the campaign of a city councilman who is running for mayor against the incumbent. This is as far as I have gotten with Season 1 but the twists and turns will keep me coming back. Good characters and interesting plot Veronica Mars Suspense, Drama ["In the wealthy, seaside community of Neptune, California, the rich and powerful make the rules. Unfortunately for them, there's Veronica Mars, a smart, fearless 17-year-old apprentice private investigator dedicated to solving the town's toughest mysteries."] {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['John T. Kretchmer', 'Nick Marck', 'Michael Fields', 'Harry Winer', 'Jason Bloom', 'Steve Gomer', 'Guy Norman Bee', 'Marcos Siega', 'Sarah Pia Anderson', 'Mark Piznarski'], 'Producers': ['Not Specified'], 'Starring': ['Kristen Bell', 'Percy Daggs III', 'Teddy Dunn']} This isn't a silly kids' story, but one that is fun to watch. Veronica's father was the sheriff of their small town where a wealthy man's daughter was murdered. The sheriff suspected the girl's father did it but he never had conclusive evidence. The wealthy man, embarrassed by the suspicions about him, had the sheriff fired. Veronica's father is now working as a private detective and she is his "girl Friday". Veronica's mother left them soon after the sheriff was fired and, so far, this is a continuing theme as Veronica attends high school by day and does her own detective work at night for her friends and looking for her mother.

I am a Kristen Bell fan and she does a great job as a teenage sluth. The first couple of episodes were interesting and well done. The second related somewhat to the first. Now, I have watched 3 and 4 and they are not as good and are "stand alone" episodes, so I'm only giving this one 3 stars. The hunt for Veronica's mother and the truth about why she left is the only relating factor.

I'll continue watching hoping the writers do a better job. Good story {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Norberto Barba', "Terrence O'Hara", 'Eric Laneuville', 'Aaron Lipstadt', 'Peter Werner', 'David Solomon', 'Steven DePaul', 'John Behring', 'Darnell Martin', 'Karen Gaviola'], 'Starring': ['David Giuntoli', 'Bitsie Tulloch', 'Russell Hornsby']} This series is well-acted and each episode is different, but on the same theme. I think sifi fans will like this, but I am not one of them. I did enjoy the ingenuity of the first few episodes, but then I got a little "much" for me. I think sifi fans will like this, but I am not one of them {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Andrew Grieve'], 'Starring': ['Anthony Andrews', 'Betsy Blair', 'Jane Curtin']} Love at first sight - married quickly - then the troubles begin. This is not a bad movie, but slowly adds suspicion then the end ... well, watch it with some popcorn and a cold drink ... fortunately, it is not too long. Predictable? {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} Casanova, the seducer, is hired to spy on the King's mistress, Madam Pompadour. Can he stay out of trouble? I doubt it. Casing the Lady
profile:
**User Summary Update:**

- **Content Preference:** Continues to seek thrilling narratives with complex character dynamics and moral ambiguity, enjoying likable yet flawed characters. Their recent review highlights a critical stance towards content perceived as predictable or lacking depth.

- **Themes:** Prefers stories that delve into intense emotional experiences around love, betrayal, and intrigue. The recent interaction expresses a partiality for originality and unpredictability, reinforcing their tolerance for suspense but with a desire for fresh storytelling.

- **Content Advisory Tolerance:** Open to exploring mature themes, including violence, tobacco use, and sexual content, while appreciating adult-oriented narratives.

- **Viewing Behavior:** Enjoys binge-watching series, particularly those with cliffhanger endings. The latest critique emphasizes the importance of pacing and thematic originality, revealing a preference for quality storytelling over formulaic plot structures.

- **Content Language and Accessibility:** Values English audio and subtitles for enhanced comprehension, though recent interactions signal a tolerance for productions without subtitles.

- **Production Quality:** Seeks high production values from reputable studios and talented casts. Their recent critique indicates disappointment in pacing and thematic repetitiveness, underscoring a desire for engaging narratives.

- **Recent Interaction Insight:** Engaged with a narrative involving a historical figure tasked with spying, demonstrating an interest in clever character-driven plots, while maintaining their critical perspective on execution and predictability.
